CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12.

Let's think step by step.

1. AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy)
2. Polymer thin films
3. OTS (Octadecyltrichlorosilane)
4. SiO2 (Silicon Dioxide)
5. Si (Silicon)
6. Substrates (implied material, but not explicitly stated)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are: AFM, polymer thin films, OTS, SiO2, Si.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
The Material Name entities in the paragraph are: polymer thin films, SiO2, Si.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| polymer thin films |
| SiO2 |
| Si |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12.

Let's think step by step.

1. AFM images: This refers to Atomic Force Microscopy images. It is a type of microscopy used to observe and measure the physical and chemical properties of surfaces.
2. Polymer thin films: These are thin layers of polymer material applied on a surface.
3. OTSmodified SiO2 / Si substrates: This refers to silicon dioxide (SiO2) and silicon (Si) substrates that have been modified with organotriethoxysilane (OTS). OTS is a silane compound used for surface modification to make it hydrophobic.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Polymer thin films
2. OTSmodified SiO2

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties. The other entities in the paragraph (AFM images, Figure 12, and Si substrates) do not directly refer to material properties, but rather to techniques used to observe or modify the material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Polymer thin films |
| OTSmodified SiO2 |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: AFM images were performed on polymer thin films on OTSmodified SiO 2 / Si substrates as shown in Figure 12.

Let's think step by step.

1. AFM images: This is a type of image data or results obtained from Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM). It is an intangible data or information.
2. Polymer thin films: These are physical entities or objects, specifically thin layers of polymer material.
3. OTSmodified SiO2 / Si substrates: This is a type of material or substance. OTS refers to Octadecyltrichlorosilane, a type of self-assembled monolayer (SAM) used for modifying the surface of SiO2 (silicon dioxide) and Si (silicon) substrates. SiO2/Si is a common type of substrate material used in microelectronics and other fields.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. AFM images: This is a type of data or information that represents the material properties of the polymer thin films.
2. Polymer thin films: These are the material entities whose material properties are being investigated using AFM images.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| AFM images of polymer thin films |
| Polymer thin films |

The "AFM images" are the property values that represent the material properties of the "polymer thin films".
